moves.5... d5: The usual move, further pressuring the center.
moves.8... Bd6: Preserving the B for later use.
moves.9. Bb5: A curious move, since the Knight will not be pinned. Seems to lose a tempo.
moves.9... e5: Taking a swipe at the QP.
moves.10. Bxc6: Conceding a minor exchange in return for doubling and isolating the Black QB pawns.
moves.10... exd4: Fischer clears out the center before finishing the piece exchange.
moves.11... bxc6: Finishing the exchange of minor pieces.
moves.12. Bg5: Pinning, and developing his last minor piece.
moves.14. dxc5: ...which Ghitescu immediately falls into. This horrible blunder costs the game after...
moves.14... Bxh2+: ...this zwischenzug. No matter how Ghitescu defends [15 KxB, 15 K-R1 or 15 NxB] Fischer plays 15... QxQ with a winning advatage in material. So Ghitescu resigns at once.
